alert.note: Alert for De Kalb (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 4:14AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Allen and southwestern De Kalb Counties through 445 AM EDT... At 413 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Huntertown, or near Garrett, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Grabill around 425 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Woodburn. This includes Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 318 and 325. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 AM EDT for northeastern Indiana...and west central Ohio.
